In addition, when you use {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter||1}, you now regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Debilitating Blow
entries: At 10th level, when you hit one target with two unarmed strikes in the same turn, you can use a bonus action to force the target to make a Constitution saving throw:
On a failure, the target has disadvantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes before the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Withstand Death
entries: At 15th level, when you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can use Second Wind as a reaction, provided you have uses of {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter||1} remaining. You can decide to use this reaction before or after your {@subclassFeature Uncanny Fortitude|Fighter|PHB|Pugilist|ToH|7} feature triggers.
In addition, when you make a death saving throw and roll a 1 on the d20, it counts as one failure instead of two.

subclassFeature.name: Opportunistic Brawler
entries: Starting at 18th level, you might not look for a fight around every corner, but you're ready in case one happens. You have advantage on initiative rolls.

In addition, when a creature you can see enters a space within 5 feet of you, you can make one {@action opportunity attack} against the creature. This {@action opportunity attack} must be made with an unarmed strike. You have a number of reactions each turn equal to your proficiency bonus, but these reactions can be used only to perform {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Pikeman
entries: You were a member of an order of knights dedicated to a deity of sun and light. You know that next to your deity's favor, a soldier's greatest strength is their comrades. You wield a spear, glaive, halberd, or other polearm as a piercing ray of sunlight against your enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Harassing Strike
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, when a creature you can see enters your reach, you can use your reaction to {@action Shove} the creature. To use this feature, you must be wielding a {@item glaive|PHB}, {@item halberd|PHB}, {@item lance|PHB}, {@item pike|PHB}, or {@item spear|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Fighting
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you deal damage with a {@item glaive|PHB}, {@item halberd|PHB}, {@item lance|PHB}, {@item pike|PHB}, or {@item spear|PHB}, you can choose for the damage to be radiant instead of its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Formation Tactics
entries: At 7th level, you bolster your allies when fighting shoulder to shoulder. While you have an ally within 5 feet of you who isn't {@condition incapacitated}, you can use a bonus action to take the {@action Help} action to assist that ally's attack roll or their next Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check.

subclassFeature.name: Foe of Darkness
entries: Beginning at 10th level, your faith and training make you a daunting foe of dark creatures. Once per turn, you can have advantage on an attack roll or ability check made against a fiend, undead, or creature of shadow.

subclassFeature.name: Give Ground
entries: Starting at 15th level, once per turn when you are hit by a melee attack, you can choose to move 5 feet away from the attacker without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}. If you do, the attacker takes {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. To use this feature, you must be wielding a {@item glaive|PHB}, {@item halberd|PHB}, {@item lance|PHB}, {@item pike|PHB}, or {@item spear|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: The Sun's Protection
entries: At 18th level, you have advantage on saving throws against spells. If you fail a saving throw against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Timeblade
entries: here are warriors who move so quickly that they seem to stop time, then there are those who actually alter time with their attacks. The timeblade augments physical attacks by manipulating temporal powers and eventually learns to step outside time itself.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Strike
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can use a bonus action to trigger one of the following effects:

entries.name: Dislocative Step
entries: You step outside of time and move to an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet of you. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}. At 10th level, you can move up to 30 feet.

entries.name: Dislocative Shove
entries: You push the target of your attack to an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet of you. You can move the target only horizontally, and before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, the target can make a Strength saving throw:
ending the movement in an unoccupied space next to the damaging terrain on a success. At 10th level, you can move the target up to 30 feet.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|short or long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Chronologic Echo
entries: At 7th level, immediately after you use your {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter||1} feature, you can trigger an echo in time, allowing you to use it twice. Roll separately for each use of {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter||1}. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Temporal Strike
entries: At 10th level, when you use your {@subclassFeature Temporal Strike|Fighter|PHB|Timeblade|ToH|3} feature, you can choose one of the following additional options:

entries.name: Chronal Cleave
entries: You immediately make a weapon attack against a different target within range.

entries.name: Chronal Shield
entries: You add your proficiency bonus to your Armor Class until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Continuity Rift
entries: At 15th level, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can instantly open a rupture in space-time to swallow the target. The creature disappears and falls through a realm outside of reality.

At the end of your next turn, the target returns to the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. It takes {@damage 8d8} psychic damage as it grapples with the mind-breaking experience. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or it acts randomly for 1 minute as if under the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Warrior
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can momentarily step outside of time to attack your foes. As an action, you can briefly stop the flow of time for everyone but yourself. No time passes for other creatures, while you take {@damage 1d4+1} turns in a row, during which you can use actions and move as normal. This effect works like the {@spell time stop} spell, except you can make one attack on each of your turns without ending the effect. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Tunnel Watcher
entries: For untold ages, the dwarves have paid in blood to keep their subterranean homes safe. The keystone to the defense of the dwarven citadels are the tunnel watchers, warriors trained in the tight, uneven paths beneath the surface of the world. While the techniques of the tunnel watchers originated with the dwarves, others see the value in such specialization. Tunnel watchers can thus be found throughout the mountainous regions of the world.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|PHB|} and {@item mason's tools|PHB|}.

subclassFeature.name: First Line of Defense
entries: Starting at 3rd level, a creature that you hit with a melee weapon attack has its speed reduced by 5 feet and can't use the Disengage action until the start of your next turn. You can't reduce a creature's speed by more than 10 feet with this feature.
In addition, when you hit a creature with an {@action opportunity attack}, you deal an extra 1d8 damage of the weapon's type.

subclassFeature.name: Fight for Every Step
entries: At 3rd level, when you take damage from a melee attack, you can use your reaction to move 5 feet away from the attacker, reducing the damage you take from the attack by {@damage 1d6} + the number of hostile creatures within 5 feet of the space you left. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

The attacker can immediately move into the space you left. This movement doesn't cost the attacker's reaction and doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}, but a creature can move this way only once each turn.

subclassFeature.name: Safe Passage
entries: Starting at 7th level, you have advantage on saving throws against traps, natural hazards, and lair actions. Traps, natural hazards, and lair actions have disadvantage when they make attack rolls against you.

subclassFeature.name: Steadfast
entries: At 10th level, you have advantage on saving throws against effects that cause the {@condition frightened} condition and effects that would move you against your will, including teleportation effects. When a hostile creature forces you to make a Strength saving throw and you succeed, you deal an extra {@damage 1d8} damage of the weapon's type the next time you hit with a weapon attack before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Cave-In
entries: Starting at 15th level, once on each of your turns when you use the {@action Attack} action, you can replace one of your attacks with a strike against a wall or ceiling within your weapon's reach or range. Creatures other than you within 5 feet of the section of wall or the floor below the ceiling where you strike must make a Dexterity saving throw:

A creature that fails this saving throw takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw takes half the damage and isn't {@condition restrained}. While {@condition restrained} in this way, a creature has {@quickref Cover|PHB|3|0|three-quarters cover} against creatures other than you. When the effect ends, the creature's space becomes {@quickref difficult terrain|PHB|4|0}.

subclassFeature.name: Against the Tide
entries: Beginning at 18th level, when you use the {@action Attack} action and hit more than one creature with a weapon on your turn, you can use a bonus action to gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the start of your next turn. When you {@action shove} more than one creature on your turn, you can use a bonus action to shove one creature within 5 feet of a creature you successfully shoved.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Concordant Motion
entries: The monks of Concordant Motion follow a tradition developed and honed by various goblin and kobold clans that favored tactics involving swarming warriors. The tradition combines tactical disciplines designed to encourage groups to work as one unit with practical strategies for enhancing allies. Where many warrior-monks view ki as a power best kept within, the Way of Concordant Motion teaches its followers to project their ki into their allies through ascetic meditation and mental exercises. Followers of this tradition value teamwork and promote functioning as a cohesive whole above any search for triumph or glory.

subclassFeature.name: Cooperative Ki
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, when you spend {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} on certain features, you can share some of the effects with your allies.

entries.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: When you spend {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} to use {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk||2}, you can use a bonus action to empower up to two allies you can see within 30 feet of you instead of making two unarmed strikes. The next time an empowered ally hits a creature with an attack before the start of your next turn, the ally's attack deals extra damage of the attack's type equal to a roll of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} die + your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Patient Defense
entries: When you spend {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} to use {@classFeature Patient Defense|Monk||2}, you can spend 1 additional {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point to share this defense with one ally you can see within 30 feet of you. That ally can immediately use the {@action Dodge} action as a reaction.

entries.name: Step of the Wind
entries: When you spend {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} to use {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk||2}, you can spend 1 additional {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point to share your mobility with one ally you can see within 30 feet of you. That ally can use a reaction to immediately move up to half its speed. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Deflect Strike
entries: At 6th level, when an ally you can see within 30 feet is hit by a melee attack, you can spend 2 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points as a reaction to move up to half your speed toward the ally. If you move to within 5 feet of the ally, the damage the ally takes from the attack is reduced by {@damage 1d10} + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level. If this reduces the damage to 0, you can immediately make one unarmed strike against the attacker.

subclassFeature.name: Coordinated Maneuvers
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you use your {@subclassFeature Cooperative Ki|Monk|PHB|Concordant Motion|ToH|3} feature to share your {@classFeature Patient Defense|Monk||2} or {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk||2}, you can target a number of allies equal to your proficiency bonus. You must spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point for each ally you target.

In addition, when you use your {@subclassFeature Cooperative Ki|Monk|PHB|Concordant Motion|ToH|3} feature to empower your allies with your {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk||2}, you can make two unarmed strikes as part of the same bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Concordant Mind
entries: At 17th level, you have mastered the ability to empower your allies with your {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2}. As an action, you can expend 5 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points and empower each ally of your choice within 30 feet of you. Each empowered ally immediately gains the benefits of all three of your {@subclassFeature Cooperative Ki|Monk|PHB|Concordant Motion|ToH|3} features. This allows each empowered ally to both move and take the {@action Dodge} action as a reaction. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Dragon
entries: You have studied at a monastery devoted to dragonkind. Warriors trained in these places adapt their fighting styles to match the dragons they hold in such esteem. They are respected and feared by students of other traditions. Once they are trained, followers of this Way travel far and wide, rarely settling in one place for long.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Affiliation
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you feel an affinity for one type of dragon, which you choose from the Draconic Affiliation table. You model your fighting style to match that type of dragon, and some of the features you gain from following this Way depend upon the affiliation you chose.

entries.name: Draconic Affiliation
rows: Black or Copper
{@skill Stealth}
Acid
Blue or Bronze
{@skill Insight}
Lightning
Brass, Gold, or Red
{@skill Intimidation}
Fire
Green
{@skill Deception}
Poison
Silver or White
{@skill History}
Cold

entries: When you make your selection, you gain proficiency in the dragon's associated skill, and you gain resistance to the listed damage type. If you already have this skill proficiency, you double your proficiency bonus with that skill.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Onslaught
entries: At 3rd level, when you use {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk||2} then hit with an attack, the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} damage of the type associated with your {@subclassFeature Draconic Affiliation|Monk|PHB|Dragon|ToH|3}.

subclassFeature.name: Take Flight
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you take the {@action} Dash action, you can spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point to gain a {@quickref Flying Movement|PHB|3|0|flying speed} equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn. While you are flying, a creature that hits you with an {@action opportunity attack} takes {@damage 2d6} damage of the type associated with your {@subclassFeature Draconic Affiliation|Monk|PHB|Dragon|ToH|3}.

subclassFeature.name: Conquering Wyrm
entries: Beginning at 11th level, when you take the {@action Attack} action after using {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk||2} in the same turn, you can spend an extra 2 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points to replace your first attack with one unarmed strike against each creature within 5 feet of the space in which you end your movement. On a hit, your unarmed strike deals an extra {@damage 4d6} of the type associated with your {@subclassFeature Draconic Affiliation|Monk|PHB|Dragon|ToH|3}. You can't use this feature and your {@subclassFeature Draconic Onslaught|Monk|PHB|Dragon|ToH|3} feature in the same round.

subclassFeature.name: Scales of the Wyrm
entries: At 17th level, you can harden yourself against harm like the eldest of dragons. On your turn, you can spend 4 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points to increase your Armor Class by 2, gain {@quickref temporary hit points|PHB|3|0} to your monk level, and gain immunity to the {@condition frightened} condition for 10 minutes. For the duration, when you take damage of the type associated with your {@subclassFeature Draconic Affiliation|Monk|PHB|Dragon|ToH|3}, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage you take from that source to 0.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Humble Elephant
entries: Like their namesake, monks of the Way of the Humble Elephant are respectful and accommodating. A large part of their training involves traveling through their home region and assisting local farmers and common folk with problems ranging from rebuilding burned homes to dispatching troublesome bandits. In areas where their Way is known, adherents are welcomed into the community and their needs are seen to in exchange for the host of benefits their presence brings to the community.

subclassFeature.name: Slow to Anger
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, when you use {@classFeature Patient Defense|Monk||2} and an attack hits you, you can use your reaction to halve the damage that you take. When you use {@classFeature Patient Defense|Monk||2} and a melee attack made by a creature within your reach misses you, you can use your reaction to force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

When you use either of these reactions, you can spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point. If you do, your first melee weapon attack that hits before the end of your next turn deals extra damage equal to one roll of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} die + your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Step
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point on your turn to ignore {@quickref difficult terrain|PHB|4|0} for 1 minute or until you are {@condition incapacitated}. For the duration, your speed can't be reduced below 15 feet. If you use this feature while {@condition grappled}, the creature can use its reaction to move with you whenever you move; otherwise, the {@action grapple} ends. If you use this feature while {@condition restrained} but not {@condition grappled}, such as by a spider's web, you break free from the restraining material unless it is capable of moving with you.

subclassFeature.name: Decisive in Wrath
entries: At 11th level, when you spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point as part of your {@subclassFeature Slow to Anger|Monk|PHB|Humble Elephant|ToH|3} feature, all of your melee weapon attacks that hit before the end of your next turn deal extra damage equal to one roll of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} die + your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Thick Hide
entries: At 17th level, you can spend 5 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points as a bonus action to gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Still Waters
entries: Monks who follow the Way of the Still Waters are like placid mountain lakes; they are still and calm until some outside force disrupts them and forces a reaction. Many adherents live a pacifistic lifestyle and never seek conflict. When strife finds them, though, they deal with it in a swift and decisive use of power and grace.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Calm
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, when you spend a {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point on {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk||2}, {@classFeature Patient Defense|Monk||2}, or {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk||2}, you also have advantage on one saving throw of your choice that you make before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Turbulent Waters
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when an attack made by a hostile creature misses you or you succeed on a saving throw, you can use your reaction to gain a Turbulence die, which is the same type as your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} die. You can have a maximum number of Turbulence dice equal to your proficiency bonus. When you hit with an attack, you can roll any number of Turbulence dice and add the total result to the damage you deal. Turbulence dice that result in a 1 or 2 are expended, otherwise you don't expend Turbulence dice when you add them to the damage you deal. You lose all accumulated Turbulence dice when you haven't made an attack or been the target of an attack by a hostile creature for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Spreading Ripples
entries: At 6th level, when a creature within 10 feet of you and friendly to you is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, you can use your reaction to gain a {@subclassFeature Turbulent Waters|Monk|PHB|Still Waters|ToH|3||Turbulence die}.

When you hit with an attack and use two or more {@subclassFeature Turbulent Waters|Monk|PHB|Still Waters|ToH|3||Turbulence dice} on the attack's damage, you can choose one creature within 10 feet of your target that you can see. That creature takes damage equal to the roll of one of the {@subclassFeature Turbulent Waters|Monk|PHB|Still Waters|ToH|3||Turbulence dice} you rolled. If you spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point, you can instead choose any number of creatures within 10 feet of your target to take that amount of damage.

subclassFeature.name: Duality of Water
entries: Beginning at 11th level, when you have no {@subclassFeature Turbulent Waters|Monk|PHB|Still Waters|ToH|3||Turbulence dice}, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}, and you have resistance to fire damage. When you have at least one {@subclassFeature Turbulent Waters|Monk|PHB|Still Waters|ToH|3||Turbulence die}, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and you have resistance to cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Tempestuous Waters
entries: At 17th level, when you spend any number of {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points, you can also choose to gain an equal number of {@subclassFeature Turbulent Waters|Monk|PHB|Still Waters|ToH|3||Turbulence dice}, up to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Tipsy Monkey
entries: Monks who practice the Way of the Tipsy Monkey lurch and waddle across the battlefield, seeming to be too intoxicated to comport themselves. Their school of fighting is typified by its low-standing stance, periods of swaying in place punctuated with bursts of wild, staggering movement, and the disorienting manner in which they seem to never be in the place they appear to be standing.

Despite the name of their style, monks of this Way often abstain from drinking alcohol, though they are not prohibited from doing so. Many do, however, display traits of their patron monkey in their love of jests and their easy laughter, even in the most fraught situations.

subclassFeature.name: Adaptive Fighting
entries: Monks of the Way of the Tipsy Monkey keep their foes off-balance by using unexpected things as weapons. Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you are proficient with {@quickref improvised weapons|PHB|1|0|}, and you can treat them as {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1||monk weapons}. When you use a {@filter magic item|items|source=|miscellaneous=Magic} as an {@quickref improvised weapons|PHB|1|0|improvised weapon}, you gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls with that {@quickref improvised weapons|PHB|1|0|improvised weapon} based on the magicitem's rarity: +1 for {@filter uncommon|items|source=|rarity=uncommon}, +2 for {@filter rare|items|source=|rarity=rare}, or +3 for {@filter very rare|items|source=|rarity=very rare}. At the GM's discretion, some magic items, such as rings or other magical jewelry, might not be viable as improvised weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Sway and Strike
entries: At 3rd level, your unpredictable movements let you take advantage of more openings. Once per round when an enemy provokes an {@action opportunity attack} from you, you can spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point to make an {@action opportunity attack} without spending your reaction. If this attack hits, you can force the target to roll a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it falls {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Jester Style
entries: Beginning at 6th level, when an attacker that you can see hits you with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to halve the damage that you take.

When you are {@condition prone}, you don't have disadvantage on attack rolls, and enemies within 5 feet of you don't have advantage on attack rolls against you. You can stand up without spending movement anytime you spend {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} on your turn.

You have advantage on any ability check or saving throw you make to escape from a {@action grapple}. If you fail to escape a {@action grapple}, you can spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point to succeed instead.

subclassFeature.name: Fortune Favors the Fool
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you miss with an attack on your turn, the next attack you make that hits a target before the end of your turn deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the weapon's type. If you make that attack using an {@quickref improvised weapons|PHB|1|0|}, it deals an extra {@damage 1d10} damage of the weapon's type instead.

subclassFeature.name: Stumbling Stance
entries: At 17th level, your staggering movements make you dangerous at a distance and make it difficult for foes to safely move away from you. If your speed is not 0, your reach is extended by 5 feet, and you have advantage on {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Unerring Arrow
entries: The inner peace of contemplation, the artistry of focused breathing, and the calm awareness which leads to pinpoint accuracy all contribute to the Way of the Unerring Arrow. Some are dedicated soldiers, others walk the path of a wandering warrior-mendicant, but all of them hone their art of self-control, spirituality, and the martial arts, combining unarmed combat with archery. Select this tradition if you want to play a character who is as comfortable trading kicks and blows as they are with snatching an arrow from the air and firing it back in a single motion.

subclassFeature.name: Archery Training
entries: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, your particular martial arts training guides you to master the use of bows. The {@item shortbow|PHB} and {@item longbow|PHB} are {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1||monk weapons} for you. Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with shortbows or longbows.

When you make an unarmed strike as a bonus action as part of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} feature or as part of a {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk||2}, you can choose for the unarmed strike to deal piercing damage as you jab the target with an arrow.

subclassFeature.name: Flurry of Deflection
entries: At 3rd level, you get additional reactions equal to your proficiency bonus, but these reactions can be used only for your {@classFeature Deflect Missiles|Monk||3} monk class feature. If you reduce the damage of the ranged weapon attack to 0 and the missile can be fired with a {@item shortbow|PHB} or {@item longbow|PHB}, you can spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point to make a ranged attack with your {@item shortbow|PHB} or {@item longbow|PHB}, using the missile you caught as ammunition.
At 9th level, when you use {@classFeature Deflect Missiles|Monk||3}, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@damage 2d10} + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.

subclassFeature.name: Needle Eye of Insight
entries: At 6th level, your attacks with {@item shortbow|PHB|shortbows} and {@item longbow|PHB|longbows} count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. In addition, when you make a ranged attack with a {@item shortbow|PHB} or {@item longbow|PHB}, you can spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point to cause your ranged attacks to ignore {@quickref Cover|PHB|3|0|half cover and three-quarters cover} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Steel Rain Blossom
entries: At 11th level, you can fire arrows in a deadly rain. While wielding a {@item shortbow|PHB} or {@item longbow|PHB}, you can use an action to fire an arcing arrow at a point you can see within your weapon's normal range. As the arrow descends onto the point, it magically replicates into dozens of arrows. Each creature within 15 feet of that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take piercing damage equal to two rolls of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} die. A creature behind {@quickref Cover|PHB|3|0|total cover} automatically succeeds on this saving throw. You can increase the steel rain's damage by spending {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points. Each point you spend, to a maximum of 3, increases the damage by one {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} die.

In addition, when you would make an unarmed strike as a bonus action as part of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} feature or as part of a {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk||2}, you can choose to make a ranged attack with a {@item shortbow|PHB} or {@item longbow|PHB} instead.

subclassFeature.name: Improbable Shot
entries: At 17th level, when you use your {@subclassFeature Needle Eye of Insight|Monk|PHB|Unerring Arrow|ToH|6} feature to ignore {@quickref Cover|PHB|3|0|cover}, you can spend 3 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points to ignore all forms of {@quickref Cover|PHB|3|0|cover} instead. The arrow even passes through solid barriers, provided you have seen the target within the past minute and it is within your weapon's normal range.

Alternatively, you can spend 5 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points to strike a target you have seen within the past minute that is now on a different plane or in an extradimensional space, such as through the {@spell plane shift} or {@spell rope trick} spells or a phase spider's Ethereal Jaunt trait. If you do so, you can't use this feature in this way again until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Wild Cat
entries: Monks of the Wildcat train relentlessly to incorporate speed, acrobatics, and precision strikes to exert control over the field of battle and foes alike. They learn techniques that emulate the grace and agility of felines, including reflexively avoiding blows and bounding between opponents with ease. Embodying the Way of the Wildcat requires intense devotion, endless practice, and no small amount of daring.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Agility
entries: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics} skill if you don't already have it. When you move at least 10 feet on your turn, you have advantage on the next Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check you make before the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Feline Reflexes
entries: Also at 3rd level, the inner power infusing your reflexes augments your nimbleness and makes it harder to hit you. When a creature you can see misses you with an attack, the next attack against you before the start of your next turn is made with disadvantage. This can happen only once each turn. If you spend 2 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points when a creature you can see misses you with an attack, you can take the {@action Dodge} action as a reaction instead.
You can't benefit from this feature if your speed is 0.

subclassFeature.name: Springing Pounce
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you move at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and hit it with an attack on the same turn, you can spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point to channel your momentum into your attack, dealing extra damage or pushing the target (your choice). If dealing extra damage, the attack deals extra damage of the weapon's type equal to a roll of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} die + your Wisdom modifier. If pushing the target, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from you. If you used {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk||2} to {@action Dash} before making the attack, the target has disadvantage on the saving throw.
You can use this feature only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Feline Reflexes
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you take no damage after succeeding on a Dexterity saving throw as a result of the {@classFeature Evasion|Monk||7} monk class feature, you can use your reaction to move up to half your speed toward the source of the effect, such as the dragon or spellcaster that exhaled the lightning or cast the {@spell fireball} that you avoided. If you end this movement within 5 feet of the source, you can spend 3 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} points to make one unarmed strike against it.

subclassFeature.name: Hundred Step Strike
entries: At 17th level, you can use your {@subclassFeature Springing Pounce|Monk|PHB|Wild Cat|ToH|6} feature as many times each turn as you want, provided you have the movement and attacks to do so. You must still spend 1 {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2} point each time you channel your momentum into your attack. Each time you move after hitting a creature in this way, you don't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}. If you miss an attack, further movement provokes {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} as normal.

If you use {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk||2} with {@subclassFeature Springing Pounce|Monk|PHB|Wild Cat|ToH|6} and hit a different creature with each attack, you can make one additional {@subclassFeature Springing Pounce|Monk|PHB|Wild Cat|ToH|6} attack without spending {@classFeature Ki|Monk||2}, provided you have the movement to do so.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Justice
entries: The Oath of Justice is a commitment not to the tenets of good or evil but a holy vow sworn to uphold the laws of a nation, a city, or even a tiny village. When lawlessness threatens the peace, those who swear to uphold the Oath of Justice intervene to maintain order, for if order falls to lawlessness, it is only a matter of time before all of civilization collapses into anarchy.

While many young paladins take this oath to protect their country and the people close to them from criminals, some older adherents to this oath know that what is just is not necessarily what is right.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Justice
entries: All paladins of justice uphold the law in some capacity, but their oath differs depending on their station. A paladin who serves a queen upholds slightly different tenets than one who serves a small town.

entries.name: Uphold the Law
entries: The law represents the triumph of civilization over the untamed wilds. It must be preserved at all costs.

entries.name: Punishment Fits the Crime
entries: The severity of justice acts in equal measure to the severity of a wrongdoer's transgressions.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of Justice Spells table. See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how oath spells work.

entries.caption: Oath of Justice Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell color spray}, {@spell guiding bolt}
5th
{@spell locate object}, {@spell zone of truth}
9th
{@spell lightning bolt}, {@spell slow}
13th
{@spell mordenkainen's faithful hound}, {@spell locate creature}
17th
{@spell bigby's hand}, {@spell hold monster}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} options. See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} works.

entries.name: Tether of Righteousness
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} to bind your target to you. As an action, you extend a line of energy toward a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it is tethered and can't move more than 30 feet away from you for 1 minute. While tethered, the target takes lightning damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) at the end of each of its turns. You can use an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check opposed by the tethered creature's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (the creature's choice). On a success, you can pull the creature up to 15 feet in a straight line toward you. As an action, the tethered creature can make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it breaks the tether.

entries.name: Justicar's Celerity
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} to respond to danger with lightning speed. When a creature that you can see is attacked, you can move up to your speed as a reaction. If you end your movement within 5 feet of the attacker, you can make one melee attack against it as part of this reaction. If you end your movement within 5 feet of the target of the attack, you can become the target of the attack instead as part of this reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Disciplined Pursuant
entries: At 7th level, you can bend the laws of magic to parallel the laws of civilization. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell or {@classFeature Divine Smite|Paladin||2}, you can choose to knock out the creature instead of killing it. The creature falls {@condition unconscious} and is stable.In addition, once per turn when you deal radiant damage to a creature, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. If you deal radiant damage to more than one creature, you can choose only one creature to be affected by this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Shackles of Light
entries: Starting at 15th level, once per turn when you deal radiant damage to a creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition restrained} by golden, spectral chains until the end of its next turn. If you deal radiant damage to more than one creature, you can choose only one such creature to be affected by this feature. The target of this feature can be different from the target of your {@subclassFeature Disciplined Pursuant|Paladin|PHB|Justice|ToH|7} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of Perfect Order
entries: At 20th level, you can take on the appearance of justice itself. As an action, you become wreathed in a garment of cold light. For 1 minute, you benefit from the following effects:

items: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
You can use your {@subclassFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|PHB|Justice|ToH|3||Justicar's Celerity} feature without expending a use of {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3}.

When a creature you can see takes the {@action Attack} or {@action Cast a Spell} action, you can use your reaction to force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it must take a different action of your choice instead.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Safeguarding
entries: Paladins who choose the Oath of Safeguarding spend their lives in service to others, conserving the people and places they vow to protect. They take missions to guard against assassination attempts, safely transport a person or group through treacherous lands, and stand as bastions for locations under attack. These paladins are no mere mercenaries, however, as they view their missions as sacred vows.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Safeguarding
entries: Paladins undertaking the Oath of Safeguarding take their responsibilities seriously and are most likely to seek atonement should they fail in their duties. However, they have no qualms about terminating their protection when their charges prove nefarious. In these cases, they won't leave people stranded in a hostile environment or situation, but they also focus their efforts on their allies over unworthy, former charges. Even when these paladins serve no charge, they seek opportunities to shield others from harm. In combat, they rush to aid their allies and stand alone to allow others to flee from battle.

entries.name: Last Line of Defense
entries: When your allies must retreat or regroup, you remain to ensure they have ample time to withdraw before withdrawing yourself. If your mission requires you to guard a building, you are the final obstacle the attackers face before breaching the building.

entries.name: Protect the Charge
entries: You pledge to preserve the lives of people you protect and the sanctity of all structures you guard, even if it means endangering yourself. When you must rest, you ensure your charge is as safe as possible, turning to trusted allies to aid you.

entries.name: Shield All Innocents
entries: In the absence of a sacred charge to protect, you endeavor to keep all those who can't defend themselves safe from harm. In cases where your charge must take priority, you do what you can to defend the helpless.

entries.name: Uphold the Vow
entries: You acknowledge the person you protect may reveal themselves as unworthy, such as by committing nefarious acts or exploiting your protection and fidelity, or the location you guard may become a site of terrible acts. When you witness this, you are free to terminate your guardianship. However, you don't leave your now-former charge in any present danger, if only for the possibility of future atonement.

entries.name: Unwavering
entries: Nothing shall distract you from your mission. If you are magically compelled to desert your post, you do your utmost to resume your duty. Failing that, you take out your vengeance on the party responsible for your dereliction.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of Safeguarding Spells table. See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how oath spells work.

entries.caption: Oath of Safeguarding Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell longstrider}, {@spell shield of faith}
5th
{@spell hold person}, {@spell spike growth}
9th
{@spell beacon of hope}, {@spell spirit guardians}
13th
{@spell dimension door}, {@spell stoneskin}
17th
{@spell greater restoration}, {@spell wall of stone}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} options.See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} works.

entries.name: Insurmountable Passage
entries: As an action, you can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} and stamp one foot on the ground. The ground within 60 feet of you magically becomes {@quickref difficult terrain|PHB|4|0} for 1 minute. When you use this feature, you can designate up to 10 creatures that can ignore the {@quickref difficult terrain|PHB|4|0}.

entries.name: Protect from Harm
entries: As an action, you can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} and speak reassuring words. For 1 minute, each friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you has advantage on saving throws against spells and abilities that deal damage. In addition, each hostile creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on its attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Preservation
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you emit an aura of safety while you're not {@condition incapacitated}. The aura extends 10 feet from you in every direction. The first time you or a friendly creature within the aura would take damage from a weapon attack between the end of your previous turn and the start of your next turn, the target of the attack has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, each friendly creature within the aura has advantage on death saving throws.
When you reach 18th level in this class, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet, and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Battlefield Controller
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can't be {@action shove|PHB|shoved}. When a hostile creature within 10 feet of you moves more than 10 feet away from you, you can use your reaction to move up to 10 feet and make an attack against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Redoubtable Defender
entries: At 20th level, as an action, you can touch your charge, typically a creature or structure, and create a magical link between you, which appears as a razor-thin, ghostly silver tether. For 1 hour, you gain the following benefits:

items: You know the general status and well-being of your charge, such as if your charge is wounded orexperiencing a particularly strong emotion, or, in the case of an object or structure, if it is damaged.

As an action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of your charge, if it is a person or object. If the charge is a structure, you can choose to teleport to any unoccupied space within the structure.
You are immune to spells and effects that cause you to be {@condition charmed} or might otherwise influence you to harm your charge.
If your charge is a creature and within 5 feet of you, the charge is immune to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it has advantage on all saving throws.

You can use an action to erect a barrier for 1 minute, similar to a {@spell wall of force}, to protect your charge. The wall can be a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 5 feet, or four contiguous 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. If your charge is a structure, the barrier can cut through portions of the structure without harming it.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Elements
entries: The Oath of the Elements is taken by those paladins who have dedicated their lives to serving the awakened spirits of air, earth, fire, and water. Such paladins might also serve a genie, elemental deity, or other powerful elemental creature.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Elements
entries: Though exact interpretations and words of the Oath of the Elements vary between those who serve the subtle, elemental spirits of the world and those who serve elemental deities or genies, paladins of this oathshare these tenets.

entries.name: Defend the Natural World
entries: Every mountaintop, valley, cave, stream, and spring is sacred. You would fight to your last breath to protect natural places from harm.

entries.name: Lead the Line
entries: You stand at the forefront of every battle as a beacon of hope to lead your allies to victory.

entries.name: Act Wisely, Act Decisively
entries: You weigh your actions carefully and offer counsel to those who would behave impulsively. When the time is right, you unleash the fury of the elements upon your enemies.

entries.name: Integrity
entries: Your word is your bond. You don't lie or deceive others and always treat them with fairness.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of the Elements Spells table. See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how oath spells work.

entries.caption: Oath of the Elements Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell burning hands}, {@spell thunderwave}
5th
{@spell melf's acid arrow}, {@spell flaming sphere}
9th
{@spell call lightning}, {@spell protection from energy}
13th
{@spell conjure minor elementals}, {@spell ice storm}
17th
{@spell conjure elemental}, {@spell wall of stone}

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Language
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you learn to speak, read, and write {@language Primordial|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} options.See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} works.

entries.name: Abjure the Otherworldly
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} to rebuke elementals and fiends. As an action, you present your holy symbol and recite ancient edicts from when the elements ruled the world. Each elemental or fiend that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action.

entries.name: Elemental Strike
entries: As a bonus action, you can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} to magically imbue one weapon you are holding with the power of the elements. Choose air, earth, fire, or water. For 1 minute, you gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) on attacks made with the weapon. The type of damage is based on the element you chose: lightning or thunder (air), acid (earth), fire (fire), or cold (water). While your weapon is imbued with an element, you can choose to deal its damage type instead of radiant damage when you use your {@classFeature Divine Smite|Paladin||2}.
You can end this effect on your turn as part of any other action. If you are no longer holding or carrying this weapon, or if you fall {@condition unconscious}, this effect ends.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Resistance
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your power over the elements forms a magical ward around you. Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage when you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|short or long rest}. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to damage of this type. When you reach 18th level in this class, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Companion
entries: At 15th level, you can call upon the service of an elemental companion to aid you on your quests. As an action, you can summon an {@filter elemental of challenge rating 2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&2]|type=elemental}, which appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. The elemental is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys any verbal commands you issue to it. If you don't issue any commands to it, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions. It rolls its own initiative and has its own turns in combat.,

You can have only one elemental companion at a time. If you summon a new one, the previous one disappears. In addition, you can't have a creature magically bound to you or your service, such as through the {@spell conjure elemental} or {@spell dominate person} spells or similar magic, while you have an elemental companion, but you can still have the willing service of a creature that isn't magically bound to you.

The elemental continues to serve you until you dismiss it as a bonus action or it is reduced to 0 hit points, which causes it to disappear. Once you summon an elemental companion, you can't summon another one until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Champion
entries: At 20th level, you can use a bonus action to manifest the unchained power of the elements. Your eyes glow with fire, your hair and clothes move as if blown by a strong wind, droplets of rain float in a watery halo around you, and the ground trembles with your every step. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain the {@quickref Flying Movement|PHB|3|0|flying speed} of an air elemental (90 feet with hover), the Earth Glide trait and {@quickref Climbing, Swimming, and Crawling|PHB|4|0|burrowing speed} of an {@creature earth elemental|MM} (30 feet), or the {@quickref Climbing, Swimming, and Crawling|PHB|4|0|swimming speed} of a {@creature water elemental|MM} (90 feet).
You have resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage.

Any weapon you hold is imbued with the power of the elements. Choose an element, as with {@subclassFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|PHB|Elements|ToH|3||Elemental Strike}. Your weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d6} damage to any creature you hit. The type of damage is based on the element you chose: lightning or thunder (air), acid (earth), fire (fire), or cold (water). While your weapon is imbued with an element, you can choose to deal its damage type in place of radiant damage when you use your {@classFeature Divine Smite|Paladin||2}.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Guardian
entries: A paladin who takes the Oath of the Guardian is sworn to defend the community. Taking the mantle of a guardian is a solemn vow to place the needs of the many before the needs of yourself and requires constant vigilance.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Guardian
entries: When you take this oath, you always do so with a particular group, town, region, or government in mind, pledging to protect them.

entries.name: Encourage Prosperity
entries: You must work hard to bring joy and prosperity to all around you.

entries.name: Preserve Order
entries: Order must be protected and preserved for all to enjoy. You must work to keep treasured people, objects, and communities safe.

entries.name: Decisive Action
entries: Threats to peaceful life are often nefarious and subtle. The actions you take to combat such threats should not be.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of the Guardian Spells table. See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how oath spells work.

entries.caption: Oath of the Guardian Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell litany of sure hands|ToH}*, {@spell shield of faith}
5th
{@spell mantle of the brave|ToH}*, {@spell spiritual weapon}
9th
{@spell beacon of hope}, {@spell invested champion|ToH}*
13th
{@spell banishment}, {@spell inspiring speech|ToH}*
17th
{@spell creation}, {@spell hallow}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} options.See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} works.

entries.name: Inspired Leadership
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} to inspire your allies with your faith. As an action, you can choose a number of creatures you can see within 30 feet of you equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). For 1 minute, each target has advantage on Strength, Constitution, and Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Turn the Wild
entries: As an action, you can cause wild creatures to flee from your presence using your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3}. Each creature within 30 feet of you with an Intelligence score of 4 or less that can see or hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can only use the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Awareness
entries: Starting at 7th level, allies around you are more alert and ready to act. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 10 feet of you can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} except when {@condition incapacitated}. When you reach 18th level in this class, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Hold the Line
entries: At 15th level, you can turn an ally's success into an opportunity. When a friendly creature you can see within 20 feet of you is forced to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant a bonus equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) to the target's saving throw. If the saving throw is successful, the target can make one weapon attack against the attacker as a reaction, provided the attacker is within the weapon's range.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Band of Heroes
entries: At 20th level, you can charge your allies with divine heroism. As an action, you can choose a number of creatures you can see equal to your proficiency bonus, which can include yourself. Each target gains the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: The target is cured of all disease and poison and can't be {@condition frightened} or {@condition poisoned}.
The target has advantage on Wisdom and Constitution saving throws.
The target gains {@quickref temporary hit points|PHB|3|0} equal to your level.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Hearth
entries: Paladins who swear the Oath of the Hearth endeavor to extend the comforts of home to others, by allaying the rigors of travel or simply assuring those who grow despondent of the possibility of returning home. Ironically, paladins who follow this oath remain far from home in pursuit of their goals. Their oath reflects the welcoming warmth and light provided by the hearth, and paladins following the oath use these elements to turn away the cold or defeat enemies who employ cold as weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Hearth
entries: Paladins who take the Oath of the Hearth accommodate all creatures and attempt to find diplomatic solutions to conflicts. Once engaged in battle, though, these paladins fight until they defeat their enemies, or their enemies surrender. They rarely extend this peaceful stance to creatures who attack with cold or desire to spread cold conditions beyond natural confines.

entries.name: Bastion of Peace
entries: Reach out the hand of friendship when encountering strangers, and advocate for peace at the outset of any meeting. Encourage your companions to do likewise. When it becomes clear your opponents wish for violence, don't shrink away from combat.

entries.name: Beacon in the Dark
entries: When winter comes and the nights increasingly lengthen, shine a welcoming light to which all people can rally. No creature shall prey on others under the cover of darkness while you are there.

entries.name: Hospitality of Home
entries: Provide the comforts of home to those who meet with you peacefully. Respect others' cultures and traditions, provided they don't espouse aggression and violence toward others.

entries.name: Protection from the Elements
entries: Ensure all people have shelter from the weather. Help during spring flooding, wintry blizzards, and when the blistering sun threatens heatstroke in the summer.

entries.name: Repel the Cold
entries: Strive against foes that seek to bring eternal winter to the world or expand their icy domains into warmer climates. Understand the necessity of the changing of seasons and seek to banish only cold that is abnormal.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Sense
entries: In addition to knowing the location of any celestial, fiend, or undead, your {@classFeature Divine Sense|Paladin||1} feature allows you to know the location of any cold creature within 60 feet of you that is not behind {@quickref Cover|PHB|3|0|total cover}.

entries.name: Defining Cold Creatures
entries: The oath of the hearth references "cold" creatures for some of its features. The most straightforward definition applies to creatures that deal cold damage with their attacks and other actions. However, this also could apply to creatures with vulnerability to fire damage, or resistance or immunity to cold damage, and creatures that use spells and other abilities that inflict cold damage or call forth non-damaging, wintry elements (such as the {@spell sleet storm} spell).

subclassFeature.name: Fiery Smite
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Divine Smite|Paladin||2} feature, you can choose for the extra damage you deal to be fire or radiant, and the extra damage increases to {@damage 1d8} only if the target is an undead or a cold creature.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of the Hearth Spells table. See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how oath spells work.

entries.caption: Oath of the Hearth Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell burning hands}, {@spell sanctuary}
5th
{@spell calm emotions}, {@spell flame blade}
9th
{@spell protection from energy}, {@spell leomund's tiny hut}
13th
{@spell guardian of faith}, {@spell wall of fire}
17th
{@spell flame strike}, {@spell hallow}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} options.See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} works.

entries.name: Cease Hostility
entries: As an action, you can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} and speak soothing words. For 1 minute, each creature within 60 feet of you that can see or hear you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw to attack another creature. A creature hostile to you has disadvantage on the saving throw. This effect ends on a creature if it is attacked or harmed by a spell.

entries.name: Turn Boreal Creatures
entries: As an action, you can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} and speak a prayer against unnatural cold. Each cold creature within 30 feet of you and that can see or hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can only use the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Hearth
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal cold damage. If such a creature succeeds on a saving throw against a spell or effect that allows the creature to take only half the cold damage on a successful save, the creature instead takes no damage. In addition, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against the long-term effects of exposure to {@hazard Extreme Cold|DMG|cold weather}. When you reach 18th level in this class, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Icewalker
entries: Starting at 15th level, you have resistance to cold damage, and you can't be {@condition restrained} or {@condition petrified} by cold or ice. In addition, you can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check, and {@quickref difficult terrain|PHB|4|0|Difficult terrain} composed of ice or snow doesn't cost you extra movement.

subclassFeature.name: Roaring Fire
entries: At 20th level, you can take on the aspects of a healthy, tended fire, radiating heat and light. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: You shed {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2|0|bright light} in a 20-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2|0|dim light} for an additional 20 feet.
Whenever a cold creature starts its turn within 20 feet of you, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage, which ignores resistance and immunity to fire damage.

Whenever you cast {@filter a paladin spell that deals fire damage and has a casting time of 1 action|spells|source=|class=paladin|damage type=fire|cast time=action}, you can cast it as a bonus action instead.

Your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage on a hit. If you deal fire damage to a cold creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute, or until it takes any damage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Plaguetouched
entries: After suffering an attack by a {@race darakhul|ToH}, you were infected with the dreaded—and generally fatal—{@race darakhul|ToH} fever. As you felt your life draining away and the grasp of eternal undeath clenching its cold fingers around your heart, you called out to any power that would answer your prayers. You pledged that you would do anything asked of you, if only you would be spared this fate worse than death.

That prayer was answered. The source of that answered prayer is not known, but its power flowed through you, helping you drive off the horrible unlife that was your fate. That power flows through you still. It drives you to defend innocents from the scourge of undeath, and it provides special powers for you to use in that fight.

subclassFeature.name: Restriction: Non-Darakhul
entries: You can choose this paladin sacred oath only if you are not a {@race darakhul|ToH}.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Plaguetouched
entries: Paladins following the Oath of the Plaguetouched share these tenets.

entries.name: Bravery
entries: In the face of terrible creatures, you stand like a wall between them and the innocent people whom those creatures would devour or transform.

entries.name: Stop the Spread of Undeath
entries: Fight to ensure the undead don't snuff out the light of life in the world.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: Creatures of undeath never tire; you must remain vigilant.

entries.name: Mercy
entries: Those who suffer disease must be cared for. If you could survive certain death, so can they. But when it is clear they are about to transform into a monster, you must end their suffering quickly.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of the Plaguetouched Spells table. See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how oath spells work.

entries.caption: Oath of the Plaguetouched Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell bane}, {@spell protection from evil and good}
5th
{@spell enhance ability}, {@spell lesser restoration}
9th
{@spell life from death|ToH}*, {@spell remove curse}
13th
{@spell blight}, {@spell freedom of movement}
17th
{@spell greater restoration}, {@spell hold monster}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} options.See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} works.

entries.name: Protective Aura
entries: As a bonus action, you summon forth your power into a shining aura around yourself. For 1 minute, you shed {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2|0|bright light} in a 10-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2|0|dim light} for an additional 10 feet. In addition, each hostile creature within 5 feet of you has disadvantage on its first attack roll each turn that isn't against you. If the hostile creature is undead, it instead has disadvantage on all attack rolls that aren't against you. You can end this effect on your turn as part of any other action. If you fall {@condition unconscious}, this effect ends.

entries.name: Turn Undead
entries: As an action, you present your holy symbol and call upon your power, using your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3}. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can only use the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Radiant Energy
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you and your allies within 10 feet of you have resistance to necrotic damage. In addition, when you or a friendly creature hit an undead creature within 10 feet of you with a melee weapon attack, the attacker can choose if the attack deals radiant damage or its normal type of damage At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark Against Death and Disease
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can expend only 1 hit point from your {@classFeature Lay on Hands|Paladin||1} pool to cure the target of a {@condition disease}. In addition, your hit point maximum can't be reduced, and you have advantage on saving throws against effects from undead creatures that reduce your ability scores, such as a shadow's Strength Drain.

subclassFeature.name: Scourge of Undeath
entries: At 20th level, as a bonus action, you can become a scourge to undead. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: The bright light shed by your {@subclassFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|PHB|Plaguetouched|ToH|3||Protective Aura} is sunlight.
You have advantage on attack rolls against undead.

An undead creature in your {@subclassFeature Aura of Radiant Energy|Paladin|PHB|Plaguetouched|ToH|7} takes extra radiant damage equal to twice your Charisma modifier (minimum of 2) when you or a friendly creature hit it with a melee weapon attack.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Trainer
entries: People have used animals in their war efforts since time immemorial. As a beast trainer, you teach animals how to fight and survive on the battlefield. You also train them to recognize and obey your allies when you aren't able to direct them. While a beast trainer can train any type of animal, they often generate a strong bond with one species and focus their training on beasts of that type.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Whisperer
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling}. If you already have proficiency in this skill, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.

subclassFeature.name: Trained Animals
entries: Beginning when you take this archetype at 3rd level, you gain a beast companion. Choose {@filter a beast that is Medium or smaller and has a challenge rating of 1/4 or lower|bestiary|source=|size=m;s;t|challenge rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=beast}. The beast is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys any commands that you issue to it. In combat, it shares your initiative and takes its turn immediately after yours. The beast can move and use its reaction on its own, but, if you don't issue any commands to it, the only action it takes is the {@action Dodge} action. You can use your bonus action to direct it to take the {@action Attack}, {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Help}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Search} action or an action listed in its statistics.

If you are knocked {@condition unconscious}, killed, or otherwise unable to command your trained animal, one of your allies can use a bonus action to command it by succeeding on a DC 10 Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check.

When you reach 7th level, you can have more than one trained animal at a time. All your trained animals can have a total challenge rating equal to a quarter of your level, rounded down. A beast with a challenge rating of 0 is considered to have a challenge rating of 1/8 for the purpose of determining the number of trained animals you can have. You can use a bonus action to direct all your trained animals to take the same action, or you can use an action to command all of them to take different actions.
To have one or more trained animals, you must spend at least one hour each day practicing commands and playing with your animals, which you can do during a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.
If a trained animal dies, you can use an action to touch the animal and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. The animal returns to life after 1 minute with all its hit points restored.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Flanker
entries: At 7th level, when you hit a creature, you can choose one of your trained animals you can see within 30 feet of you. If that trained animal attacks the creature you hit before your next turn, it has advantage on its first attack roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Bred for Battle
entries: Starting at 11th level, add half your proficiency bonus to each trained animal's AC, attack rolls, damage rolls, saving throws, and to any skills in which it is proficient, and increase each trained animal's hit point maximum by twice your proficiency bonus. In addition, you can choose Large and smaller beasts when you select trained animals.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Whirlwind
entries: At 15th level, when you command your trained animals to use the {@action Attack} action, you can choose for one trained animal to attack all creatures within 5 feet of it, making one attack against each creature.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Grove Warden
entries: Fiercely protective of their territory, alseid herds form close bonds with their home forests. In return for their diligent protection, the forests offer their blessings to dedicated alseid rangers. In recent years, woodsy adventurers of other races who have earned the forests' trust also received this blessing, though their numbers are scant. These Grove Wardens can tap into the living magic of ancient forests. Your senses travel through the plants and earth of the woods, and the very land rises up to strike down your enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Grove Warden Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Grove Warden Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

entries.caption: Grove Warden Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell entangle}
5th
{@spell branding smite}
9th
{@spell speak with plants}
13th
{@spell hallucinatory terrain}
17th
{@spell animate objects}

subclassFeature.name: Whispers of the Forest
entries: At 3rd level, when you use your {@classFeature Primeval Awareness|Ranger||3} feature while within a forest, you add humanoids to the list of creature types you can sense. When sensing humanoids, you know the general direction of the creatures, and you know if a humanoid is solitary, in a small group of up to 5 humanoids, or a pack of more than 5 humanoids.

subclassFeature.name: Forest's Will
entries: At 3rd level, you can magically draw on the living essence of the land to hamper your foes. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Your next weapon attack against that creature has advantage. If that attack hits, the creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. When you reach 11th level in this class, if that attack hits, the creature's speed is instead halved until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Intruder's Bane
entries: At 7th level, you can command the land around you to come to your aid. As a bonus action, choose a point you can see on the ground within 60 feet. You cause the area within 15 feet of that point to undulate and warp. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, a creature is pushed up to 15 feet in a direction of your choice and knocked {@condition prone}. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Forest
entries: At 11th level, you can call on the land in your vicinity to strike at your enemies. When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can use a bonus action to make a rock, branch, root, or other small natural object attack a creature within 30 feet of you.
