entries: If the linked target failed its saving throw against your lingering spell, it has disadvantage on the saving throw to avoid the additional damage at the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Shared Hunger Spell
entries: If you use this Metamagic option on the linked target, you and the target regain hit points equal to double your Charisma modifier (minimum of 2) if the target hits with its weapon attack.

entries.name: Twinned Spell
entries: By spending 1 additional sorcery point, you can affect the linked target in addition to the two original targets.

subclassFeature.name: Spore's Protection
entries: Starting at 14th level, when an attacker you can see targets you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to call forth spores to cloud its senses. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. If the attack hits, you gain 10 {@quickref temporary hit points|PHB|3|0} as the spores bind the wound for a short time. The {@quickref temporary hit points|PHB|3|0} last for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Spore Form
entries: At 18th level, you gain immunity to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition. In addition, as an action, you can radiate spores in a 20-foot radius around you for 1 minute. Each friendly creature that starts its turn in the area regains hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of 1). Each hostile creature that starts its turn in the area takes poison damage equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of 1). The target of your {@subclassFeature Spore Transmission|Sorcerer|PHB|Spore|ToH|1} regains (if it is friendly) or takes (if it is hostile) double this amount. Once you use this action, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Wastelander
entries: Eldritch power and residual magical energy left over from a horrific arcane war is drawn to you as a lodestone is drawn to iron. Perhaps this attraction is due to a pact one of your ancestors made with an ancient eldritch horror. Perhaps it is an unfortunate twist of circumstance. Regardless, your physiology is in a constant state of transformation as a result of your condition. Some sorcerers who arise from magical wastelands embrace their body's modifications, others take to adventuring to find a cure for what they see as their affliction, while others still seek to make a mark on the world before oblivion claims them.

subclassFeature.name: Alien Alteration
entries: At 1st level, the influence of raw magical energy in your bloodline remodeled your form. You choose one of the following features as the alteration from your ancestry.

entries.name: Binary Mind
entries: Your cranium is larger than most creatures of your type and houses your enlarged brain, which is partitioned in a manner that allows you to work on simultaneous tasks. You can use the {@action Search} action or make an Intelligence or Wisdom check as a bonus action on your turn.

entries.name: Digitigrade Legs
entries: Your legs are similar to the rear legs of a wolf or horse. Your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you can stand up from {@condition prone} by spending 5 feet of movement rather than half your speed.

entries.name: Grasping Tentacle
entries: You can use an action to transform one of your arms into a grotesquetentacle. The tentacle is a natural melee weapon with the reach property, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with it, you can use Charisma instead of Strength for the attack, and the tentacle deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Charisma modifier. At the start of your turn, if you are {@action grapple|PHB|grappling} a creature with the tentacle, you can deal {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage to it. You don't have fine motor control over your tentacle, and you can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of spells. You can revert your tentacle back into an arm as a bonus action.

entries.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: You have a prehensile tail, which allows you to take the {@action Use an Object} action as a bonus action on your turn. Your tail can't wield weapons or shields, but it is capable of some manual precision, allowing you to use your tail to hold material components or perform the somatic components of spells. In addition, you can interact with up to two objects for free during your movement and action, provided you use your tail to interact with one of the objects.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Physiology
entries: Starting at 1st level, when a creature scores a critical hit on you, you can use your reaction to shift the positions of your vital organs and turn the critical hit into a normal hit. Any effects triggered by critical hit are canceled.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Transformation
entries: At 6th level, your increase in power also increases the concentration of raw magical energy in your blood, further altering your body. The alteration you chose from your {@subclassFeature Alien Alteration|Sorcerer|PHB|Wastelander|ToH|1} feature evolves as described below. Alternatively, you can choose a second option from the {@subclassFeature Alien Alteration|Sorcerer|PHB|Wastelander|ToH|1} feature instead of evolving the alteration you chose.

entries.name: Caustic Tentacle (Grasping Tentacle)
entries: Your tentacle excretes acidic mucus. You can use a bonus action to suppress the mucus until the start of your next turn. While the tentacle excretes acidic mucus, it deals an extra {@damage 2d6} acid damage to any target it hits. A creature that is {@condition grappled} by your tentacle at the start of your turn takes the extra acid damage when it takes the bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Cognitive Split (Binary Mind)
entries: Your cranium expands even further as your brain swells in size. When you use your action to cast a spell, you can use a bonus action to make one melee or ranged weapon attack against a target in range.

entries.name: Fell Sprinter (Digitigrade Legs)
entries: Your legs elongate and your body sheds some of its weight to allow you to reach greater speeds. You can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of your turns. When you {@action Dash}, the extra movement you gain is double your speed instead of equal to your speed.

entries.name: Third Arm (Prehensile Tail)
entries: Your tail extends to a length of 15 feet and the end splits into five finger-like appendages. You can do anything with your tail you could do with a hand, such as wield a weapon. In addition, you can use your tail to drink a potion as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Absorb Arcana
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that would deal damage to you, you can use your reaction and spend a number of {@classFeature sorcery points|Sorcerer||2} equal to the spell's level to reduce the damage to 0.

subclassFeature.name: Spontaneous Transformation
entries: At 18th level, your body becomes more mutable. You can use a bonus action to gain a second option from the {@subclassFeature Alien Alteration|Sorcerer|PHB|Wastelander|ToH|1} feature and its evolved form from the {@subclassFeature Advanced Transformation|Sorcerer|PHB|Wastelander|ToH|6} feature for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|short or long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Ancient Dragons
entries: You have made a pact with one or more ancient dragons or a dragon god. You wield a measure of their control over the elements and have insight into their deep mysteries. As your power and connection to your patron or patrons grows, you take on more draconic features, even sprouting scales and wings.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Great Dragons allows you to choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Ancient Dragons Expanded Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell inflict wounds}, {@spell inflict wounds}
2nd
{@spell heat metal}, {@spell scorching ray}
3rd
{@spell dispel magic}, {@spell lightning bolt}
4th
{@spell greater invisibility}, {@spell ice storm}
5th
{@spell cloudkill}, {@spell flame strike}

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Tongue
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can speak, read, and write {@language Draconic|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Wyrmling Blessing
entries: Also starting at 1st level, your connection to your draconic patron or patrons bestows a blessing upon you. When you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}, you choose which blessing to accept. You can have only one blessing at a time. The blessing lasts until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

entries.name: Aquatic Affinity
entries: You gain a {@quickref Climbing, Swimming, and Crawling|PHB|4|0|swimming speed} equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater. In addition, you can communicate with beasts that can breathe water as if you had cast the {@spell speak with animals} spell.

entries.name: Draconic Hunger
entries: When you are below half your hit point maximum and you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you regain hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus. This feature can restore you to no more than half of your hit point maximum.

entries.name: Draconic Sight
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, this blessing increases its range by 30 feet. In addition, you can use an action to create an invisible sensor within 30 feet of you in a location you can see or in an obvious location within range, such as behind a door or around a corner, for 1 minute. The sensor is an extension of your own senses, allowing you to see and hear through it as if you were in its place, but you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses while using this sensor. As a bonus action, you can move the sensor anywhere within 30 feet of you. The sensor can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain|PHB|4|0}, and if it ends its turn inside an object, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. You can use an action to end the sensor early.
A creature that can see the sensor, such as a creature benefiting from {@spell see invisibility} or {@sense truesight}, ees a luminous, intangible dragon's eye about the size of your fist.

entries.name: Elemental Versatility
entries: Choose one of the following when you accept this blessing: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. You can't change the type until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest} and choose this blessing again. When you deal damage with a spell, you can choose for the spell's damage to be of the chosen type instead of its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Mien
entries: At 6th level, you begin to take on draconic aspects. When you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}, choose one of the following types of damage: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. You have resistance to the chosen damage type. This resistance lasts until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

In addition, as an action, you can harness a portion of your patrons' mighty presence, causing a spectral version of your dragon patron's visage to appear over your head. Choose up to three creatures you can see within 30 feet of you. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} (your choice) until the end of your next turn. Once you use this action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Ascended Blessing
entries: At 10th level, your connection to your draconic patron or patrons grows stronger, granting you morepowerful blessings. When you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}, you choose which ascended blessing to accept. While you have an ascended blessing, you receive the benefits of its associated {@subclassFeature Wyrmling Blessing|Warlock|PHB|Ancient Dragons|ToH|1} in addition to any new features of the ascended blessing. You can have only one blessing active at a time. The blessing lasts until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

entries.name: Aquatic Command
entries: While this blessing is active, you receive all the benefits of the Aquatic Affinity {@subclassFeature Wyrmling Blessing|Warlock|PHB|Ancient Dragons|ToH|1}. You can cast the {@spell control water} and {@spell dominate beast} spells without expending spell slots. When you cast the {@spell dominate beast} spell, you can target only beasts that can breathe water. You can cast each spell once in this way and regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

entries.name: Crystallized Hunger
entries: While this blessing is active, you receive all the benefits of the Draconic Hunger {@subclassFeature Wyrmling Blessing|Warlock|PHB|Ancient Dragons|ToH|1}. When you kill a creature, you can crystallize a portion of its essence to create an essence gem. This gem functions as an {@item ioun sotne, protection|DMG|ioun stone of protection}, but it works only for you and has no value. As a bonus action, you can destroy the gem to regain one expended spell slot. You can have only one essence gem at a time. If you create a new essence gem while you already have an essence gem, the previous gem crumbles to dust and is destroyed. Once you create an essence gem, you can't do so again until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

entries.name: Draconic Senses
entries: While this blessing is active, you receive all the benefits of the Draconic Sight {@subclassFeature Wyrmling Blessing|Warlock|PHB|Ancient Dragons|ToH|1}. You have {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 15 feet, and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

entries.name: Elemental Expertise
entries: While this blessing is active, you receive all the benefits of the Elemental Versatility {@subclassFeature Wyrmling Blessing|Warlock|PHB|Ancient Dragons|ToH|1}. When you cast a spell that deals damage of the chosen type, including a spell you changed using Elemental Versatility, you add your Charisma modifier to one damage roll of the spell. In addition, when a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to deal damage of the chosen type equal to your proficiency bonus to the attacker. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Manifestation
entries: At 14th level, you can assume the form of a dragon. As an action, you can transform into a dragon with a challenge rating as high as your warlock level divided by 3, rounded down, for 1 minute. This transformation works like the {@spell polymorph} spell, except you can take only the form of a dragon, and you don't need to maintain {@condition concentration} to maintain the transformation. While you are in the form of a dragon, you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. For the purpose of this feature, "dragon" refers to {@filter any creature with the dragon type, including dragon turtles, drakes, and wyverns|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&0;&6]|type=dragon}. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@quickref resting|phb|2|0|long rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Animal Lords
entries: While humanoids have vast pantheons and divine figures of every stripe, the animals of the world have much simpler forms of faith. Among each species there is always one paragon that embodies the animal spirit in a humanoid form, the better to speak to others and represent the animals in the fey courts and the Upper Planes. These timeless entities are connected to every animal of the kind they represent, and their primary concerns are for the well-being of these animals and the natural world as a whole.

Your patron is one such animal lord. Animal lords are varied in their motivations and often come into conflict with each other. They each command legions of animal followers and gather information from all of them. Unlike many other patrons, animal lords often have close relationships with those they bind with pacts, some to control, others to guide and advise. You are your animal lord's hand in the affairs of humanoids, and your allies are as numerous as the spiders in the corner or the birds in the sky.

You choose a specific animal lord to be your patron using the Animal Lord table. Each type of animal in the world can potentially have an animal lord. If you want to follow a specific type of animal lord, work with your GM to determine the animal lord's affinity and beast type and where that animal lord fits in the world. For a deeper dive on specific animal lords and for their game statistics, see Creature Codex and Tome of Beasts 2. These books aren't required to choose an animal lord as your patron or to play this class option.

entries.caption: Animal Lords

Air
